website_summaries.verdict: With bases included that keep these poles upright, they're easy to use.
pros: Poles use flat PVC bases that keep them spread 24 inches apart, which meets competitive guidelines
Included stakes keep the base adhered to the ground for outdoor training
Base allows for poles to be set up indoors or outdoors
Has no metal edges for safety
cons: Poles are wobbly if the dog bumps into them, which can affect training success

customer_reviews.title: Indoor house or garage weave pole setup
customer_reviews.text: Our yard is muddy, so we set this up inside. Free standing it is easily knocked over...and the sound of it hitting the floor is not pleasant for human or dog. We made it work by using a set of puzzle mats. By cutting some small holes in the puzzle mats...we have a nice surface, cushioned... non slip...and quiet. With the mats, the poles are stable even when stretched out. We are lucky to have a nice large playroom to put these in...but this set up could work in a garage as well.
customer_reviews.author: ladybug

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.text: The package was supposed to contain stakes for securing the base into the ground--they were missing. The weaves are not suitable for a 50 lb dog as the dog will knock them over when they are not staked! They are lightweight and easy to assemble but not sturdy enough for a medium sized dog. I also ordered them before I went to my dog's National Specialty, so I didn't receive them until I returned October 7. So by the time I assessed them, it was too late to return them. Cool Runner also makes one with a steel frame, and I would like to try that one instead. Unfortunately they are not sold on Amazon...so I am stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: You can use like the picture (they do this in the beginning) then ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today. What I was surprised (happily) is that basically you just open the bottom bars (blue bars) and stick the poles in. Can not get any easier than that. You can use like the picture (they do this in the beginning) then slowly make the bars closer and closer. This is how they train weave poles until they are in a straight line. My dog is a sheltie 23 pounds. Very high energy but not that big. For me this should work just fine so we can practice his agility weave in between classes!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating agility product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use in the house, nice packing for storage. But the poles are very wobbly and won't stay secure for use. Constantly have to be readjusted for the next round of practice. We've used these now for a few months and are ready to toss or get a refund. The threads for the poles to hold them upright are not working and we have tried using duct tape, which defeats the purpose of easy up and easy put away. Not happy with this product and our training is lacking with the dog due to having to fix after every weave through.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Lofton

customer_reviews.title: so it's nice to back up to a more open setting to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this successfully over the last few months with our 3 year old Australian Shepherd. We practice only a couple times a week for short increments. We still don't have it down to run perfectly straight, so it's nice to back up to a more open setting to reinforce the proper behavior. It sits out in our yard in the Chicago suburbs in the hot sun and rain and has held up just fine. Haven't had it outside in freezing weather, so I don't know how brittle it might become.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hoekstra

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with performance
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This set is sturdy for small to medium sized dogs (that is all I own), easy to set up & tear down, light to transport, stores easy, works well indoors and outside for early weave training, reasonable price, fast shipping. Cons: the only con I have experienced is that it is difficult to weigh down for indoor use once the dog is weaving properly. I would definitely recommend this item, despite the one drawback I've experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Rosann

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone starting out teaching a dog the weave will love this...I have a very small space (inside) to train my dog (actually my living room and dining area)..set up and take down is less than a minute since it folds up so one can store it in a close, without having to take it apar t...I pull it out every morning and send her through it several times and she has become very comfortable with the poles..great quality for the price, easy to take apart and even a bag to carry them in!
customer_reviews.author: AE

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use indoor. Easy to set up and move. Able to stake them down on the ground if used outdoors (although I am using them inside). If you have a dog who hits the weaves hard, you might want to take them down to the floor so they don't shift at all -not a problem for my small breed. Wish I had purchased a 12-pole set since we barely started using these and my dog is almost done with novice level (the only place in AKC you will see just 6 poles). To that end, I wish there were a means to connect another set to make these a 12-pole set. However, I am super happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Nies

customer_reviews.title: Good for my Newfie!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! We have a Newfoundland and he can easily get through the poles. It’s simple to collapse and has a carrying case! It’s a great product, super happy with my purchase! (Please excuse my mess in the video! Have 4 wild kids and a Newfie!!)
customer_reviews.author: Marvelous MelissaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but product fails after a few times
customer_reviews.text: Really excited about getting these weave poles for training my young dog. I would use them indoors and outdoors and easy to move. However after a few weeks of using the screws holding the poles upright stripped out and the poles started leaning or not even staying upright. Just sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Nettles

customer_reviews.title: Works well - worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was needed. Before this, I used some spare wood pieces set into the ground - looked shoddy. This thing sets up quickly. looks pro and is easy to move. As long as it's not manhandled I'm thinking they're durable. A tip - when moving it, fold the base up on the ground before lifting it. It all fits together and is very easy to set-up. A definite upgrade in looks and function.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Wright

customer_reviews.title: great product for the price but not for large fast dogs
customer_reviews.text: These were an inexpensive and lightweight set of weaves that do everything I need them to do. They work great to train my younger dog who is gentle and careful. They aren't sturdy enough for my advanced dog who plows through weaves but I have staked them down with tent stakes and they hold up just fine. I'm not sure how well they'd do if my advanced dog was much larger (he's a 40lbs border collie) but it was a great buy for us. Just add some stakes and electrical tape to the poles (helps dogs see the poles better) and they're a great buy for the price. I'll probably order a second set one of these days.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Good set up to start teaching weave technique
customer_reviews.text: The poles are good, but it still needs something stronger than the stakes to keep the base in place, since the platform moves. However, it would work good as an initial training tool to teach a dog to weave. Mine already knows how to weave. So I want to continue with the proper straight line to continue good form. Now, I am looking for some additional U-shaped stakes to put over the base so it doesn't shift.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Break very easily
customer_reviews.text: This weave pole set has some pluses: it is easy to set up and take down, folds accordion style for storage, and can be used with channel training. However, two of the bases on mine broke off the screws they are attached to the first time I tried to remove the poles from the cups they sit in. As other reviewers indicate, they are flimsy. I tried supergluing them back to the base/screw, and that didn't work. So if you buy these, be very careful when removing the poles from the base cups for storage. Hold the base cup to stabilize it before twisting the pole out. Better yet, buy a sturdier set to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: NM dog handler

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these weaves! But the box was completely trashed and the bag to carry the weaves in was cut up. I'm sure I didn't do it because once I noticed the cut in the fabric I tried to replicate the cut with my scissors and they didn't even make the slightest mark on the fabric. The cut was 3 inches long and clean. I noticed that the fabric was marked from a cutting knife in several places. The weaves themselves are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Janice  Elvidge

customer_reviews.title: Best I can do during wi ter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very easy to ensemble set of weave poles. They are also easy to store. I use them inside during winter. They tend to slide around on my wooden floors a bit. I have a 17 lb dog and they are generally fine but if you have a bigger dog, they might move too much (inside).
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Handiest weave poles in the world!
customer_reviews.text: These are really helpful weave poles. I can set them up in the garage, the house, or the driveway. My only suggestion is that they shouldn't be so loose. The poles move a little too easily so it's hard to get a straight line out of them. It takes too many adjustments to get a straight row. But the portability of these weave poles is fantastic! I can fit twelve of them behind the front seat of my car. Somebody had a great idea with these things.
customer_reviews.author: Janet,  the Poodle Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great practice weaves!
customer_reviews.text: Great set of weaves for backyard practice - lightweight, portable, easy to set up. I have small-medium dogs though - this might not be for you if you have a big dog who blasts through the poles Stretched out all the way, poles are 24" center to center, the current recommended spacing for many organizations.. If you plan to use as a channel, be aware that because of the accordion base this alters the spacing of the poles.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to put together and the carry case keeps everything ...
customer_reviews.text: With the negative temps outside, we were able to use inside for a little playtime. It was very easy to put together and the carry case keeps everything organized and easily stores.Only issue was I never received the grass stakes and some of the blue caps for the tops of poles were missing. would have given 5 stars if it wasn't missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly a

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic junk, screws fell out after 5 uses,.. about 40 days.. plastic holes were to worn to re-insert the screws. Do yourself as Big Favor and buy a higher quality set
customer_reviews.author: prairie sage

customer_reviews.title: ack, they do not stay in one piece, ...
customer_reviews.text: ack, they do not stay in one piece, if my dog even touches the pole it bends. the bottom looked to be well made in the photo but is very light weight. ok for small breeds but not for med/large dogs, the wind blows it over. its ok for the price but not for heavy duty use. the poles do not fit securely into the base so you have to really twist them in there.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Chernoff

customer_reviews.title: Training another dog using 2x2 and this is working great. Lightweight--easy to assemble so I can train at ...
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the quality. I have a dog that is rough on the poles and these did not knock out when she passed through. Training another dog using 2x2 and this is working great. Lightweight--easy to assemble so I can train at the park with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Murphy Graham

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for beginning agility trainers.
customer_reviews.text: We are total amateurs agility training Sadie for fun at a local dog training business. We bought this and a couple other items to supplement the once-a-week lessons. This item was the best buy of the lot. Sadie is pretty good on all the agility challenges except the weave polls which I am told is by far the hardest to train for. With daily practice, Sadie is really getting the hang of it. The weave poll set is very quick to set up and take down, especially if you have ~2X1 foot space to store it with the polls inserted,
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ingersoll

customer_reviews.title: Great Set of Weaves
customer_reviews.text: My dog is small (4.6 pounds) and these work great for me. I've been using stick-in-the-ground poles and these are much easier to set up and move around for variety.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Pole junk
customer_reviews.text: These are very cheap weave poles. The poles are plastic and they start breaking near the bottom of the poles. I would not leave them outside because they get rusty.
customer_reviews.author: Scruf14

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for, really decent weaves!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm VERY happy with my medium size dog being able to weave in my living room with this poles that break down to carry elsewhere. one pole came cracked but usable.
customer_reviews.author: Rottieluver

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of weaves for training
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of training weaves. They are easy to set up, fold up for easy storage and to take with you to train in different places. The folding enables you to set up 2x2 training method and gradually unfold as your dog progresses. They are lightweight which is great for storage and moving them around. I have used them to train my tervuren, but my friends BC used these poles - they wobbled and moved but held up to her tearing through them.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Warner

customer_reviews.title: Weave magic!
customer_reviews.text: During our long winter, we can practice weaves inside with this great set. Because the poles can be maneuvered, you can set a channel and train a new dog to weave. Great product. Not sure if it would last if left outside, but probably would be ok if you brought it inside after practice.
customer_reviews.author: kcg

customer_reviews.title: Good for basic learning
customer_reviews.text: These are light weight poles and would not stand up to a heavier dog running into them. The poles are friction stuck in the holes and come out easily. OK for my 30lb. dog who is very careful.
customer_reviews.author: radarsmom

customer_reviews.title: I love them as they are light weight and a great ...
customer_reviews.text: My weave poles have stayed outside in the weather since they arrived. I love them as they are light weight and a great beginning weave. Easy to pack up and go. Can be mounted to the ground as ones dog progresses. Comes with a zipper bag. Would not recommend for those dogs already trained and fast as these are very light weight. Mine are holding up great as practice in the back yard.
customer_reviews.author: elliott

customer_reviews.title: Bent pole
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to let you know that there was one of the poles had a big bend in it and there were no Stakes included. Very unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Best agility purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant buying yet another set of poles, but I wanted a flat base. I had been using pvc pipping ones before which i can never remember how to put together correctly. I didn't want the heavy metal. This was my best agility purchase ever. They are light and easy to fold up and put in the bag to take anywhere. They are not metal, but the base is similar to what we see in competition. They are flimsy, but for my two yorkies, it doesn't matter. For a bigger dog you would need to stake them down.
customer_reviews.author: skater

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up/moveability/storage
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up/tear-down/move around. Great for our small dogs. Wish it had additional stabilizers at one end so center line is continuous when 2 sets are used together.
customer_reviews.author: Red Sox Fan

customer_reviews.title: They are sturdy, easy to set up and manipulate depending on ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is just what my Belgian Malinios needed to helper her understand how to do the weave poles. They are sturdy, easy to set up and manipulate depending on our needs. It also comes with a nice carrying case for when we take them down. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Erica James

customer_reviews.title: These have been perfect for indoor practice
customer_reviews.text: These have been perfect for indoor practice. The set is light, but the supports keep it upright even when the poles are closed all the way while the dog is at low speed. We're working on increasing our speed, so I'm not sure yet what the top speed threshold is before they start getting knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: Amy W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little weave pole set
customer_reviews.text: Nice little weave pole set. It works well for teaching a dog to weave. The poles are adjustable and can be made wide apart to teach weaving or you can straighten them for a dog that knows how to weave. Good purchase for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Fine product
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that actually exceeded my expectations. It's well made and comes with a nice carrying case. Of course, you need two sets to have complete weaves, but the two sets together cost about one-quarter of the professional stuff (which has a really heavy steel base). These sets can be used for early training without the anchors, which makes it fairly easy to set up and take down. The only potential drawback is that I don't know how well it would hold up to abuse from advanced fast dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Lucius

customer_reviews.title: I like that you can train with a shoot style of ...
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can train with a shoot style of training, two of my dogs are making great progress with them but they are very flimsy and one of the polls was broken when I got them.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use inside and outside. When I bought them one of the pieces was broken but still functional. After a couple uses though the poles would not screw in all the way and now they just lean to one side or the other. Defiantly would have invested in more expensive but durable weave poles if I knew how flimsy these are.
customer_reviews.author: jenny g.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these for Christmas because good friends who do agility both have them and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for Christmas because good friends who do agility both have them and I liked using theirs. My dog is up to 12 poles and not at an angle but I can see a new dog these would be great for teaching 2x2 method. They are light weight and I can set them up quickly in the back yard. Keep in mind that I have a golden retriever and she is not real fast in the weaves. Might not be as great for a really fast moving active boarder collie but for most dogs learning or just practicing they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight weave poles with lots of adjustment. They come in a case that makes them easy to travel with or store. You can tape them to the floor for indoor use. If you take care of them they are a decent quality and would last.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Good weave set for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this weave pole set for about a week now and I'm loving it! Just started agility training with my aussie mix last month and he is becoming a rockstar in class since now we can practice at home! One of the cups that the pole sits in detatched from the base and the screw won't stay tight, but a little superglue fixed it right up, so no complaints! I love that I can use it indoors or outdoors! Being able to channel them is great too for teaching the dogs how to reallllly bend and use their back legs correctly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Stowers

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: When first order arrived the box was damaged, the bottom structure was bent and 2 of the poles were cracked, so I returned it and ordered another. The second order arrived, but there were no stakes and three of the stakes were damaged. Not worth the time or money
customer_reviews.author: Daria Hagenloch

customer_reviews.title: Nice set but arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I love the set however it arrived with one of the cups that hold the poles completely stripped and I will have to either find a larger screw or super glue it. It's not a big deal but I would have expected it to arrive complete and not broken.
customer_reviews.author: flubbercat

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Easy to set up. Stand great for a 60lbs dog running through them. They seem durable so far. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Trainor

customer_reviews.title: Meh - they are ok
customer_reviews.text: I suppose I need to really consider getting what I pay for. These are very flimsy and I constantly have to pull out a screwdriver and tighten the pole holders. Several of the poles were bent.
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Light plastic base
customer_reviews.text: The base twist real easy due to weight of poles. Had it set up once and within minutes the base was twisted to where one end of poles was on ground and the other half standing up.
customer_reviews.author: SarahT

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for what I want to use it for
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for what I want to use it for. Training my puppy to do weaves use the 2X2 method. The base could be a little sturdier. The first pole tends to lean toward the side so I've been putting a stone under the base to straighten the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works great. However the poles r a loose fit in the base.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Story

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: A little flinsy for large dogs, but good deal for the money
customer_reviews.author: Nan wishwood

customer_reviews.title: I liked the idea of it but not very practical for ...
customer_reviews.text: Poles were very flimsy plastic. One of the poles was cracked when it arrived. I liked the idea of it but not very practical for any dog over 10 pounds. I sent it back. Still waiting for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Trapp

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of weave poles for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set of weave poles for the money. Great for practice, easy to set up inside or outside. I liked my first set so well I purchased a second set so we have 12. My dog learned the weaves quickly having our own to practice with.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Sheets

customer_reviews.title: Spacing and adjustability is good. Flimsy construction doesn't work well for big fast ...
customer_reviews.text: Spacing and adjustability is good. Flimsy construction doesn't work well for big fast dogs. Mine didn't include stakes and these poles don't work without them but any grass stake works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Morrisroe

customer_reviews.title: Good product for little money.
customer_reviews.text: Good for trying out different training techniques for the web. Surprisingly steady and comes with spikes to keep down if needed. We haven't needed them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gudny S.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Having trouble because your dog saunters through the weaves? No problem, these can be set up for channel weave use or regular spacing. As they learn to zip through at maximum speed, progress by closing the alley. And they have a METAL base, which makes these an all time value (not to mention the carry bag)!!! I'm extremely pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: dog loverone

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: good light weight adjustable training tool for teaching dog to do weave poles. Durability and sturdiness yet to be determined but so far very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah V. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: This is working great for training weaves to my young dog
customer_reviews.text: This is working great for training weaves to my young dog. However, the first pole is loose and tippy. I am worried that it will come loose and fall and scare her. I have tried to tighten it, but my wrench does not fit in the hole very well, and will not hold the nut so the screwdriver can't tighten the screw.
customer_reviews.author: spotted one

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with this set
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this set. It comes with a carrying case and is easy to set up and take down. It is not as sturdy as a metal set, but is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Great stability for indoors work (I havent used outdoors yet or tested ground stakes). I love the fact I can change the sharpness of the turns depending on the dog's skill level e.g. beginners should set up so that the dog can basically run in a straight line and advanced tighter so it is essentially weaving.
customer_reviews.author: Caledonia

customer_reviews.title: Great weave poles for the price.  Easy to set up an easy to pack away
customer_reviews.text: I love these weave poles. I am planning to ordering another six.they are easy to set up an easy to pack away
customer_reviews.author: Ilene Lartitegui

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult to work with but overall does what it’s supposed to
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to move around but the concept is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up-comes in a nice carry bag. Works just as advertised and is plenty sturdy. Dogs used it quite readily.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good for those who are learning agility. Durable enough for casual use.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton Farrand

customer_reviews.title: I like these were reasonable priced and good enough for limited ...
customer_reviews.text: These work well indoors on a flat surface. Had to move our home training from the back yard to garage this winter after an extended period of cold weather made the ice prohibitive for outside. I like these were reasonable priced and good enough for limited home training.
customer_reviews.author: JHDenver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, easy set up, take them anywhere. Recommend guide wires for beginning dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 old sheltie has been struggling in agility class because we took off the guide wires. He already knows what to do but needed extra practice. I bought these and set them up in the kitchen at home. He figured it out in 3 days!
customer_reviews.author: SheltieLife

customer_reviews.title: Backyard weave practicing
customer_reviews.text: This is really a good tool for backyard weave practicing. My 35# border collie can use it without steaks in the ground and it doesnt fall over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: pretty decent. have 2 large breed dogs at 70+ lbs each. they learned weaves 2x2 method from this and my agility instructor got these for her smaller breed dogs. also these things come in a really nice carrying case. if you stake them in the ground you will really get them stabilitzed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small to medium size dog but not for a big dog!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times with my big lab. It works okay but I am afraid once I get the weaves closer together it will not work very well. The plastic is not very rigid and I am afraid that he will push them out of the way. They when he gets on a real set he will has issues because the poles will not move out of his way and he will have to weave more. Probably a really good product for small and medium size not but definitely not for a larger dog. I think they are well made and probably last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Justlabs

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Can be placed in a straight line or ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Can be placed in a straight line or as shown in picture, depending how advanced your puppy is. They are easily moved to new areas where my set in the ground is not moveable. Good choice for practicing agility weaves.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Roock

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to use for all of my dogs - beginning and advanced - the poles are very easy to quickly adj for 2x2's or in a straight line!
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Compact storage & Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: The carry bag came with two complete jumps, including a crossbar for each and stakes to stabilize, if desired. The jumps are very easy to assemble & disassemble and fit nicely in the carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic portable poles
customer_reviews.text: I love that these come apart and pack up very easily. We did the 2x2 method for weave poles and these are perfect if your dog has learned to do 6 straight poles.They can be opened up if your dog needs a little help (like hard entrances) but cannot be separated to start the 2x2 method. They don't come apart like my homemade plastic poles! I will be buying another set shortly.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great set to practice indoors. Light and portable but sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: wer2carrz

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for training to use poles. It's cheap and flimsy, but it works. It has lasted many uses an far.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: These are great to work on teaching weaves. I love that they are lightweight and have a bag to carry. Looking forward to all the fun we'll have.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nowak

customer_reviews.title: Received with some broken parts.
customer_reviews.text: So far the product looks decent for the cost. However, I received it in a damaged box and one of the poles has a 2 inch break in it. Another pole has a broken end cap. Don't really want to return the set, but would like to have the poles replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: These are great for small homes. They fold away and come with their own bag. Channel method of training weaves and can be extended to regular weaves (six).
customer_reviews.author: Dansuncafe

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: An awesome affordable set of weaves for channels. Works really well for my small dogs and is perfect for car travel. I also have a set of regular weaves with a metal base but find this is much easier to use for training. Planning to order an additional set!
customer_reviews.author: D.Mor.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it inside, so it's a little flimsy for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: brmsy

customer_reviews.title: ... and the pole does not stand tall- I would like a much more story design
customer_reviews.text: The blue part has bent and the pole does not stand tall- I would like a much more story design !
customer_reviews.author: certinut

customer_reviews.title: I like that it is portable
customer_reviews.text: Over product is suitable for my needs; I like that it is portable, and is easy to move to different locations; however, I would have preferred a sturdier base.
customer_reviews.author: dogs4me

customer_reviews.title: These a re a decent set of weave poles.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice for using on solid surfaces, though they would not hold up to a large dog hitting them. They're a little clunky to use for 2 x 2 training since you have to unscrew the pieces, but it is workable. They've been good for the initial 2 x 2 training I'm doing withe my Doberman.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Muntz

customer_reviews.title: Really great and works for 2x2
customer_reviews.text: Really great and works for 2x2, channel, and straight weave poles. Maybe not the most sturdy materials, but that would raise the cost.
customer_reviews.author: R. Stegmaier

customer_reviews.title: but I love how portable it is
customer_reviews.text: It's a little bit flimsy, but I love how portable it is, and that you can transition from the 2X2 method very easily. My dog is a star in the weave poles after having these for only a week. It made all the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Marny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these adjustable poles. They are very well made and solid.
customer_reviews.author: TrTownshend

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great, inexpensive equipment for training. I have a slow, 18# dog. Might want something more stable for a larger and faster dog.
customer_reviews.author: LChamp

customer_reviews.title: Great for backyard training
customer_reviews.text: Great for backyard training. The base is thick plastic. I wish it was a little heavier but it does its job and does provide holes that allow you to secure it to the ground
customer_reviews.author: Kat Hersman

customer_reviews.title: Great training weave pole set.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Great for training weave entries and weaving in various locations without a lot of set up hassel. Love these!!!
customer_reviews.author: SheridanGi

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a beginner. Easy to put together and use.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for beginners. My dog has had no problems learning weave with this set. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I love how adjustable the pole are. They really made teaching my dog a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: docile.doom

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginners Weave poles
customer_reviews.text: Great for practicing weaving! And very easy less than 5 minute set up!
customer_reviews.author: Robert I Pinkham

customer_reviews.title: Good, affordable weave set
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to assemble, but sturdy for my miniture schnauzer to use in learning how to weave.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These weaves are great for practicing at home
customer_reviews.text: These weaves are great for practicing at home. Easy to assemble and they fold up into a bag for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sweepy

customer_reviews.title: Dog Agility Weave Poles you can take anywhere.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. It is perfect for helping young dogs learn about weave poles.
customer_reviews.author: LuvMyDogs

customer_reviews.title: Loved by dog and handler
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog that is sensitive to the curved based of pvc indoor weave poles. Love that these are flat base and can be used inside. Easy to carry and the bag is great.
customer_reviews.author: Cool Cat

customer_reviews.title: easy set up
customer_reviews.text: easy set up, easy disassembly. one thing to keep an eye out for is the the screws that keep each joint and pole together. they sometimes come loose. just use a phillips head screw driver to snug it back down.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my small indoor setup. Good for initial training and practice.
customer_reviews.author: MyraM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small to medium dogs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for small to medium dogs. Used these for training Heelers and perfect as you can adjust the angles for the lesser advanced. String two together for the full monty. Not for grass. Use for tile/concrete etc.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick A. Cambier

customer_reviews.title: Great Weave Poles.
customer_reviews.text: These weave poles are great! Easy to set up, easy to use, easy to store. They are a little tall, otherwise are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Metal27

product_meta.title: Agility Weave Poles Adjustable 6 Pole Set with Carrying Case and Grass Stakes
product_meta.description: Agility Weave Poles Adjustable 6 Pole Set with Carrying Case and Grass Stakes. Weave poles are measured from center of pole to center of pole for 24” not on the inside of the poles
feature_bullets: Fully Adjustable, can be configured as 2 by 2's
2 Foot Centers, Flat to the Ground Base

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
